question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about the conventions of Roman drama, the various ways in which we can make deductions from historical evidence, and about the effects of Roman drama on later drama.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
Reading ancient Roman scripts (tragedies, comedies, and historical drama). 
Identifying and analyzing different stock characters and their role in the plot and how they represented Roman values and perspectives. 
The interaction of politics and stage performances in ancient Rome.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: All things Roman drama. We talked about different types of plays, staging, scripts, tropes, Roman culture, politics, and more.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about Roman tragedy, Roman comedy, and how to use different types of fragmentary evidence to make conclusions and learn about ancient Roman theater.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1) Examining different kinds of evidence ranging from script fragments to artistic depictions of Roman drama 
2) Considering the roles of participants, patrons, audiences, and everyone in between in regards to the integral role of drama in Roman society
3) Discovering the tropes and stories of Roman comedy, tragedy, and historical drama, and considering their impact on modern storytelling.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: We had reading assignments for each class, which worked well. The extra credit/make-up assignments were also excellent. The midterm and final project options were very interesting and fun.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I liked the group workshops where we all would analyze different parts of a script and talk about our findings.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Professor Ginsberg is awesome. Such an inspiring person to learn from, even as someone not involved in classics. Reading long articles or full scripts can be tedious, but the discussion questions always keep you thinking and challenge you to analyze the text more deeply as you read. In-class discussions are always lively and filled with fascinating details. She asks questions that would never cross your mind but make you re-evaluate how you see the Romans. I think the layout of the course is really conducive to learning, discussion, and engagement.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I really liked all of the plays that we read and the discussion board homework assignments on them. It was really cool to see my peers' thoughts on the readings and the discussion questions made me read more carefully. I also really liked having options for midterm and final assignments. While both options sounded interesting, I felt like I could choose the option that I felt the most confident on, which was super helpful.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: This class was INCREDIBLY thoughtful in its construction. Professor Ginsberg truly brought the ancient to life in the present by encouraging us to engage directly with evidence and notice patterns for ourselves. This easily could have been a boring, lecture-style class, but she invited us into the incredibly exciting world of being a Roman dramatist and made us all feel welcome in that space no matter our background. The combination of workshops, research, readings, discussions, lectures, and more created a learning environment that was vibrant and different every day.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: It was really neat to learn what historical evidence we have and how to interpret it!

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I had no idea the role of politics in ancient roman drama and how it could be used as a vessel to safely criticize politicians.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: There are so many fascinating things about Rome and Roman theater that I would never have learned without taking this course. For the first time I am thinking about the Roman Empire, as the meme goes, several times a week. Reading the actual plays and learning about the real people behind it all really puts everything into a new perspective

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: All of the small group discussion in our in class workshops was stimulating because I got to hear ideas from classmates and bounce my own ones off of them.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Professor Ginsberg's enthusiasm for the course content created an environment where everyone was encouraged to engage with the material in a really personal way. That created a collaborative, fun energy amongst the students - I felt like we all came to class every day excited to dig into new evidence.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Lauren Ginsberg is amazing and you should take the class. There are also many opportunities to make up work or get extra credit.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: The scripts are so interesting! I never knew roman plays had so much drama. Plus, Professor Ginsberg IS SO PASSIONATE AND SO KNOWLEDGEABLE about this topic. It was genuinely fun to watch her lecture.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Take it!! Don't hesitate. I was unsure going into it. I am not a classics student, just someone with a vague interest from taking Latin. In all honesty I was just looking for a not-boring CZ credit. But this ended up being my favorite class this semester. It was interesting, engaging, a manageable work load, and I learned so much. It really rekindled my interest in Rome and was a fun refreshing part of my day.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Definitely take this class!

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: TAKE IT TAKE IT TAKE IT!!! You couldn't ask for a more exciting Area 2 Theater Studies class or CZ credit. If you think history is boring, just wait until Professor Ginsberg sweeps you up in the world of Roman drama, including everything from pranks to dragon chariots to the most insane things you could do to another person. It's awesome.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot about public policy which was something I hadn't focused on here at Duke.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot about what arts policy was, from the history of it to how it relates to my everyday life. I also learned great project-based skills like time management and communication. Furthermore, I learned how to write a policy brief, which is something I didn't know how to do before.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Critical analysis of policies and institutions - i.e. considering how institutions are created and situated, and how this impacts the people attracted to this institution and how that institution is perceived

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I was able to build knowledge in U.S. public policy, art and the intersection of both in a very engaging and practical way.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot of subtle, overlooked concepts. Creative placemaking, the interplay of public/private/non-profit institutions, and this is the biggest thing: a greater appreciation of arts institutions & events around me. Before this class, I really didn't look to go to museums or art exhibits or dance performances. However, my positive experiences with these aforementioned things have motivated me to go to more events around campus and Durham. I think this is most notable with the performances in Page Auditorium. I will also say this course has helped me network/ reach out when working with my community partner. This was especially relevant when I wanted to include an extra component in the project and I had to gather the resources/data from different teams in the organization and outside.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Understanding of public arts policy decision-making

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about what exactly is arts policy, various cultural institutions and its issues, leadership and value in the arts, cultural equity (audience and access, heritage and repatriation), creative placemaking, and creative economies.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: We reviewed case studies in arts leadership, visited local cultural organizations, and discussed the challenges facing the arts today. A central component of the course was the extended engagement with a community partner, so we developed our collaborative skills.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to think about art in a different and new context. I also learned professional skills through the service learning aspect of the course.

response_text: This course was one of my favorites so far at duke. Professor Nurkin is extremely engaging, and he makes learning fun! I had no prior knowledge of arts policy, yet he managed to keep me engaged the whole time.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I greatly appreciated how the course began with establishing a solid theoretical framework, which we then continuously applied to practical scenarios. The instructor's engaging approach, thoughtful questioning, and attentive listening fostered a dynamic and inclusive learning environment.​

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The absolute free-for-all structure of the discussions really helped me open up. I was never afraid to share my opinion, instead maybe I was more hesitant by ruminating and tweaking how I was going to say an idea. It also helped a very natural dialogue that was insightful. This is very dependent on the people in the class, though. I know there were 6-7 key yappers, but in a class with more shy people or only a few key people speaking, it would be much more anxious/forced.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Class visits and excursions

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: This course is probably the most impactful class I have taken at Duke because I learned and experienced so much. We were put into group projects to help with a specific arts organization, where we gained so much insight on what it is like to help with arts administration as well as policy. We also went on multiple class excursions that allowed us to understand how the audience interacts with the art institutions, as well as our experience with it. Everything in this course- especially the content- was so meaningful and important for me to learn about.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

It gave us something tangible to relate what we learned in lecture.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The field trip aspect and organization of the lectures made this class extremely intellectually stimulating.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Class discussions could be very intellectually stimulating, though some discussions felt overly long and became unproductive. Something that could make this course more intellectually stimulating is if the class environment was more conducive to everyone/anyone being able to talk, as opposed to allowing some class conversations to be monopolized by a few people - i.e. efforts to bring in other voices too

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The class was intellectually stimulating due to its thoughtful discussions that connected theoretical concepts to real-world policies. Engaging in group work at the end of each session allowed us to apply theories in practical contexts, enhancing our understanding and retention.​

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The biggest stimulating factor were the fieldtrips & the semester long project. They were more dynamic and allowed us to incorporate a lot of skills we personally had. It gave us an organization or community to reach out to, which helped. I think tying the fieldtrips back to the concepts we learned was enlightening. This was most seen in the writing assignments, such as the discussion posts. There was a lot of critical thinking and realization that "oh yeah, this particular institution shows a concept we highlighted in class" or "I did not even realize this institution probably had to mull over their economics & that this affected their policy." I think the final paper was kind of shoved in there at the end, but I much prefer that over any final exam.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: More stimulating if we talked more about specific examples closer to us

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: This class was very engaging! It was especially interesting for me because I wanted to learn everything about Arts Policy, and I wanted to gain as much information in this field as possible. I think the only caveat was that the class felt a little long sometimes, since it was over 2 hours, but we had breaks in the middle of it. However, mostly the whole class was very stimulating and engaging.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: It was great to hear about Prof. Nurkin's work. I found the readings and discussions sometimes somewhat unengaging. I would love more emphasis on excursions.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I was passionate about the topics, which made it stimulating to me.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Take it!! This course is incredibly engaging and will get you plugged into the Durham arts scene. As long as you stay on top of your work, you should have no problem doing well.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This class is perfect for students interested in exploring public policy and the arts, even without prior experience. It offers hands-on collaboration with NGOs, allowing students to apply classroom concepts to real-world challenges and make a tangible impact. The instructor excels at facilitating thoughtful discussions on complex topics, actively listening, and encouraging students to develop their leadership skills in a super supportive environment.​

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

response_text: Definitely take it! Even if you have just a little bit interest in arts, this course will be very fulfilling to take!

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: One of the things I learned from this course was how to think outside the box. I was able to develop new skills of detail reading and thinking. Another thing I learned was annotating my thoughts with complete sentences. This allowed me to think freely, but also little by little it gave birth to awesome and newer ideas. Third thing I learned was how to write an "essay". I loved how much freedom we had to write our essays and I enjoyed the process of focusing on something we found really interesting.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned so much! Coming into the course, I was really nervous because I didn't have much experience reading Shakespeare. It was great to be surrounded by actors in the class who could help me better read and decipher the plays as we covered them.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I feel like I learned how to closely read Shakespeare and hone in my analytical skills, especially with medieval works.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I developed a sense of the theatrical... an better understanding of how the written word can be played with in many ways, and nuance can be created through acting decisions... This changed the way I think about performance in dialogue and conversation in general

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. The art of attention! How to read Shakespeare with extreme attention and empathy

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned so much in this class, both about Shakespeare in general (trajectories in his work, frameworks for evaluating the plays) and about several individual plays! I also improved my close reading and argument writing skills.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Dr. Beckwith is a wonderful professor— so kind, caring, knowledgeable, and genuinely interested in what her students think. response_text: Professor Beckwith is extremely enthusiastic about Shakespeare, and her passion is passed on to the students in her class! We are encouraged to voice our own opinions, whether or not they contradict hers. She has a great respect for each student's perspective.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Dive in as much as you can

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Take this class (or if not this one, something else with Dr. Beckwith)!! It’s one of my favorite classes I’ve taken at Duke. To be fair, I already knew I loved Shakespeare before I took the class, but it seems like even students who weren’t as experienced with Shakespeare enjoyed the class. You will have to do a lot of reading— it helps if you watch the plays instead of just reading them (take advantage of Duke Libraries’ access to wonderful productions by companies like the RSC, Stratford Festival of Canada, and Globe Theater), but also have a copy with good notes in the margins (like the Folger or Arden edition). There are only two major written assignments, which means that each one counts a lot in your grade, but I didn’t mind because it meant that for most of the course we could focus on reading the plays and discussing them in class.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I enhanced my understanding of the need to be gentle with my body, and I learned to release rigidity in how I view myself, accepting my functioning without judgement. I also particularly liked learning about the “means whereby” being preferable to “endgaining”. Lastly, I learned a lot of anatomy about breathing and the skeletal structure and how to feel those things within myself.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I gained a deeper understanding of "self" and became more in touch with my body-mind connections. I learned about primary control, constructive rest, body mapping, the various parts of the body, breathing techniques, and dealing with performance anxiety. I will apply these skills to my dancing and my life in general.

Through this course, you can learn how to connect with the arts in a meaningful way within the context of culture and intellectual engagement. I would especially recommend this if you are interested in theater studies, though you’ll also get a fruitful experience if your interest is more aligned with visual arts. Professor Bend is so kind and intelligent, and just a wonderful person and professor. I would especially recommend this course if she is teaching it again.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: If you like theatre you’ll love this course! Torry is such a great professor and the city has so much to do and excellent food and theatre.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: If Tory is teaching it I believe that if they truly want to learn more about the arts they should it under her guidance.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Learning how to use the elements of directing, giving solid feedback & critiques, & learning how to professionally take critiques & comments.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learn a lot about directing, in both the skills of directing, like how to making the directing note book and i learnt a lot about the meaning of being a director.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to formulate an approach to directing a play from all stages of research to performance, establishing basic design choices, what makes theater engaging, and ultimately developed a better of sense of my directorial aesthetic.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about the elements of form, a variety of approaches to directing, and the details and historical context of several major plays. I developed the skills of directing and of analyzing, and feel much better prepared to continue directing in the future.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: In this class I learned how to deepen my ways of thinking in a director's perspective. I learned about visual storytelling and how to tell a story in so many different ways. I also learned how to take myself out of an actor's standpoint in a scene and look at it from a directing point of view- which includes putting yourself in the audience's shoes, so really I just learned perspective. I spent a lot of time thinking about stage composition when directing my scenes, which was also a great way to deepen my creative visions.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. How to work with given circumstances, such as using only the Brody space and the items in the cabinet.
2. Always pick pieces that you are passionate about, find things to be passionate about the pieces.
3. How to critique and give feedback in a constructive manner, looking out for elements and speaking in "what-if"s.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The in class discussions were helpful, as were the presentation on the elements.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The professor is always giving feedback patiently and i love the mode to get both feedback from the classmates and professor.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The project progression throughout the semester was extremely helpful as each assignment built cleanly on the last. I really liked that we started with element studies to gain a shared vocabulary that informed the rest of our discussions.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: We had a good balance of reading and practical experience. I would absolutely keep the element studies and silent scenes. Limiting the given circumstances to the items in the directing closet made us focus really carefully on light, which I really enjoyed. The model we used to give each other constructive feedback also worked very well. It was also helpful to have the complete syllabus at the start of the year.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The readings of the essays and plays, the journals, the scenes, and the feedback all added up to create the structure of learning for this class. I thought the most engaging methods of learning were the peer feedback after a scene in class- as well as the journals, since it allowed us to be honest about our directing process and reflect on what we've learned so far.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: With a smaller class, this was easier, but Jeff consistently made the class an inclusive environment where he encouraged each of us to speak. He always respected our opinions and answered my many questions. I would say that the structure of the class definitely facilitated learning because we left 15-20 minutes after performances to discuss each one in depth. Also, there were some classes where we would just spend the day in discussion and hearing from Jeff, and those were super helpful for me.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The readings, the conversations, & the projects.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The class is with the most excellent professor in the school and the class design is so good to offer students time to explore what they want to do.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The course readings were extremely interesting and complemented the work we were doing in class really well. I also think that establishing a culture of proposing 'what-ifs' to ask questions rather than impose judgement and making sure students don't defend their choices made a really positive course environment.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The variety of practical exercises, readings, and discussion were intellectually stimulating. Through the journals and in-class discussions, we also had time to discuss our thoughts on theater and directing broadly (e.g. analyzing plays we had seen or how theater related to our lives), which I really appreciated.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The collaborative leadership in scenes and communication between the actors and peers made this class as stimulating as it was.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: This class was very stimulating because we consistently incorporated texts and theoretical books, such as A Director Prepares, with real-world examples as we were actively directing and in rehearsals. I think this duality stimulated both the mind and my creativity and ability to engage directly. I was able to take the things that I was reading about and incorporate them into rehearsals.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: It is a lot of work in terms of projects, but they do not feel like work because of how engaging the course is & how helpful the professor is. If you are passionate about theater, this is a class that will give you much experience and understanding of the profession.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This is a challenging course that requires a lot of careful thought and time spent outside of class to read and rehearse everything. With that said, I learned so much about theater and feel really confident in my ability to direct a full-length production in the future. I would highly recommend this class and any opportunity you can get to work with Jeff.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Jeff Storer is the best professor at Duke. (All right, it might be a tie between a few. But the point stands. Take the class. Also, Brody Theater is awesome.)

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I think no matter if you are interested in theater or not, this class is well versed in the theater and directing community and you really just learn so much. There is a lot of reading but for a good reason.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: TAKE IT! This is a phenomenal class, and I used to think I enjoyed directing and I had directing experience, but I learned so much more about all the different components. I realized that there is still so much to explore. I think that the next step in this journey is to assistant direct something, so that I can continue to explore and learn. I would not have been able to come to these realizations without this class and without Jeff. Really, this is a class you must take if you are remotely interested in theatre.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot about how to present, critique and take critiques to improve my work. This really increased my confidence! I learned about how to draw and show emotion through drawing. I learned about many ways to add color and texture to sketches to show my ideas.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: develop concept/sketch/draw/character design

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to conduct research specifically focused on clothing and design, how in-class student critique is structured, and the fundamentals of painting with watercolor.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
I finally picked up watercoloring again after many years. In this class, I learned about different methods to apply water colors (dry on dry, wet on wet, using salt or alcohol on the paper, etc.). I also learned about using undertones for shading.
In terms of costumes, I learned of the new frontiers of costume technology, such as fiber optic lights and thermochromic material, and how they are applied to theater. In a more "ways of thinking," aspect, I was surprised at how the same text can inspire countless variations in different settings, time periods, eras, etc. (and that these can also be seen on the stage, such as the Tempest that took place on a cruise or a women's prison).

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I have acquired a lot of sketching skills, for instance imagining human heads as eggs and how sketching is very similar with algebra. Oh I also learned how to steam clothes from Hannah. Crucial life skills! I definitely have to work on watercolor painting more in the future.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
I honed my drawing skills during the course, particularly in capturing human bodies and motions. The emphasis on drawing loosely to convey movement greatly benefited my figure sketching. Additionally, I delved into watercolor techniques, although my primary focus remained on figure drawing.
The course also provided ample opportunities to refine my concept development skills. I learned to take my understanding of a text and expand it into a comprehensive concept. While the course didn't specifically emphasize the quality and completeness of concepts, I dedicated time to enhance my ability in this area.
Lastly, I cultivated the skill of critiquing my peers' work. I gained insights into their thought processes and the journey leading to their final products. Engaging in in-class critiques provided valuable exposure to such situations and significantly contributed to my familiarity with the process.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Fabric, watercolor, rough sketch of costume

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The course was small and the instructor encouraged everyone to contribute and share their ideas. Teaching us to give positive and helpful critiques from the start made me feel less judged when presenting my work and able to help others constructively. Hands on rendering activities and discussions were well balanced. There was an overall very encouraging, forgiving, and positive learning environment which I think helped me engage a lot more than I would in a bigger class or with a different instructor. One on one midterm meetings helped me see my progress. The professor was very understanding of our needs and abilities and adjusted deadlines/expectations to fit all students. I think this made everyone work harder and reach their own potential.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The course was very focused on critique and repeated iterations of a project, which was impactful because it challenged me to improve my designs each time rather than being satisfied with the first rendition. I also found the in-class practice for sketching and use of artistic media to be helpful, as I was not at all familiar with watercolor and didn't have any formal knowledge of figure drawing.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think the class critiques were a big help. As mentioned above, everyone brought their own backgrounds and perspectives/interpretations of each piece, and that really opened up my eyes to how I could make my own designs more accessible/ open to general audiences.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text:
The critique sure helped me a lot. I enjoyed being affirmed (haha of course) by someone who is more authoritative than me in the field, and also my peers. And they offered gentle suggestions that helped me a lot.
A simple 3 minute sketch everyday to keep track of my mood each day is something that I would keep for future years. I loved that way of keeping traces of my daily life. It's meditative as well.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: The class serves as an introduction to the field of costume design, making it accessible without requiring any prior knowledge. Currently, the course is primarily hands-on, emphasizing extensive sketching and drawing practice. Although our drawing abilities are not directly evaluated, they play a significant role in the course. If there's a prerequisite for this class, it would be a passion for drawing or, at the very least, a willingness to engage in frequent drawing practice.Structured akin to a standard art course, regular critiques and presentations are integral components, occurring nearly every week. Beyond providing an overview of costume design, the course offers an immersive art school experience for those inclined toward design. Hannah, the instructor, excels in communication and adeptly facilitates meaningful discussions, enhancing the overall experience of this discussion-intensive class.I wish the class is offered twice a week instead of once.

response_text: I learned about basic studio art methods, particularly about pencil sketching and watercolor painting. I learned about the costume design process in a practical sense (budgeting, scheduling). I learned how to apply research to the design process.

response_text: I learned various design principles as they apply to costuming, drawing and watercolor techniques when rendering the human figure, practical considerations when designing for a show (budget, swatching, sourcing), and script analysis.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: The course is inspirational and stimulating, especially for students wanting to go further in the arts field. It is a great course for emerging artists; however, the workload is heavy, with many hands-on crafting assignments. It is a difficult but intellectually stimulating course.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: The process of designing lights for a theatrical production, a greater appreciation for the role that lighting plays in everyday life, and the specific software, jargon, and methodologies used by theatrical lighting designers.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned the theory of how to light theater and dance performances, how to use software to implement this theory, and how to physically hang and focus lights.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- Developing a plan to augment a theatrical performance using lighting design
- Using lighting design software used in industry. Specifically how to patch, program, and change lighting units using the EOS software.
- Learned about the different types of theater lights, when to use them, and their positions on the stage. Talked about the effects that different types of intensity, movement, and light color can have on a performance's mood and atmosphere.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

2. I learned how to hang lights within a theater.
3. I learned how to successfully use eos software to program the lights in a theater.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I developed understanding of common terminology in lighting design and technical theater as well as an understanding of the general design and application process of light in a theatrical production. The course has a nice balance of the amount of hand-on experience and lecture, providing me equal opportunities to learn the terminology of the field and to develop a better sense of how the process really looks like. I have also got the opportunity to see the creative process of professionals working in the field of light design as well as the professional standard for associated paperwork in the industry.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

I feel much more competent with all the equipment and theory than I did at the beginning of the class. Learned about moving lights as well.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I thought that the course was intellectually stimulating. As I mentioned earlier, having more opportunities to work on real projects and performances instead of just projects for the class would have helped me explore lighting design at a higher level.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

However, the assignments are less open to students with a different perspective and aesthetic language than the majority of the student body since the assignments are graded based on how well it is perceived in the most general and common perspective.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

It is at a balance of artistic training and technical training, exposing students to both theatrical design and technology. The course functions well as an introduction into theatrical technology in general with lots of hand-on opportunities.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
I learned how to examine stage directions and interpret their deeper meaning in relation to the themes and symbolism of a play.
I learned the importance of knowing context surrounding an author/playwrite because it significantly impacts how the play is received.
I learned how set design and lighting can enhance audience experience without it being completely consciously understood. Tone and mood are important.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: The prospect of reading and analyzing plays was itself a new methodology for me, and one I'm please to say I have enjoyed. Reading plays is a unique skill and I think this course did a fantastic job providing some guidance on how to do that without ever coddling or resorting to a "how to read theater" style lecture. In terms of insights, I think the course provided an outlook on the breadth and depth of American literature genres, styles, and movements in the past century or so, and has generally made more more eager and open to further exploring the category.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Professor D'Alessandro was exceptionally receptive to all idea regarding each play. Art is subjective, and he never made us feel like our opinion was wrong as long as we could back it up with evidence from the text. He was very open to admitting if one of our points had changed his mind or was a new way of interpreting the play.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I loved this class a lot. I'm sad it's ending. Professor D'Alessandro created a super warm, fun, and welcoming class environment that fostered a lot of lively discussion about the text and got everyone engaged regardless of their personal background (or lack thereof) with theater. He was always willing to chat about the text and clearly cared about us as students and people. I liked the pace of the class—I felt super accomplished that I read like 2 texts a week in the class. I like the response posts and the fact that they are on Monday was helpful because I could read and think over the weekend and felt like I could take risk because there was low-stakes grading. I really enjoy the lectures at the start of class, especially learning about a playwright's background and watching clips of the texts live. The conference structure before essays was helpful. My peer review drafts were always horrible but at least they forced me to get something on the page. I also really liked the variety of plays we read, especially the political plays at the end and how different they felt from more abstract expressionism stuff at the beginning. The bad choices assignment was also fun.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Professor D'Alessandro, Kate, and Julia all did an excellent job guiding class discussions, providing jumping off points and keeping the class moving through some very interpretable texts with a very opinionated seminar without ever stifling discussion. It felt easy to share in class, even if my thoughts were not fully formed, and the environment felt casual enough to make jokes and foster some camaraderie while still feeling very intellectual.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I honed the skill of delving into unfamiliar topics, conducting thorough research, and crafting compelling stories based on them. The course consistently challenged us to write scripts on subjects we had no personal experience with or prior knowledge of. I gained proficiency in gathering both primary and secondary resources, covering historical contexts, technical details, and cultural backgrounds.Additionally, I mastered the art of writing within tight deadlines. With a weekly writing assignment, I learned to draft quickly and then focus on revisions rather than getting bogged down by details in the initial draft.Lastly, I cultivated the ability to provide constructive feedback to my peers in class. question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

—how to get in touch with the Muse, the subconscious, the inner self.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I love how every class is just a read through of each other's plays and a discussion of what worked and didn't. Every week I looked forward to coming to this class.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: In this class, we write to learn. Prof Bell gives us so many opportunities to just write and read each others work. I believe that's the beauty of this course and the thing that facilitated my growth as a writer.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Every week we had to read the plays we wrote inspired by a prompt. Mr. Bell was really good at giving constructive feedback. At first I was terrified because I felt like I would be the worst in the class and present absolute garbage to the class. I'm not sure if the quality of my work has improved but everyone was really nice.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Professor Bell is a friendly and good natured. He is supportive. His feathery disposition encourages students to take big leaps. Still he is honest when he doesn’t quite like something. He should continue to be supportive in future years.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Writing specifically for the stage. I had experience with other methods of writing, but did not have exposure to theater writing. This course gave me hands-on experience with that. I also became more comfortable sharing my work with others. Finally, I learned how to tell a compelling story from start to finish, and also how to craft scenes based on specific, engaging prompts.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I developed my writing skills, took constructive criticism, and learned how to make an engaging story.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I developed my ability to write long-form scripts for the stage. I improved my skills at writing believable dialogue. I worked on my story-writing skills based on a given prompt and creatively interpreting set boundaries.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to write for plays! It is a very new style of writing to me and at first I was quite unfamiliar with it, but after writing a couple of scenes, I've gotten the hang of it and learned how fun and flexible this writing style is. It is interesting since you have to also consider stage directions since ultimately you are writing for a play which will be acted on stage, so it is cool to think about how your story and play will appear on stage and think about what stage directions are the most effective to achieve your vision of the play.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: How to think about injecting drama in playwriting, how to build plot, and how to improve dialogue.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: How to write for the stage, how to format scripts, how to best use language for dramatic effect.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to channel my creativity through play writing plays.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Working on dramatic writing, how to work towards good absurdism, and minor play literacy

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- Learned how to structure a play
- Learned how to write for a stage, rather than just tell a story throughout words, including stage directions, use of the stage, costumes, effects etc
- Learned how to talk about theatre

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I liked how we did the work outside of class and read them out loud in class. This gave us time to think our pieces through and see them played out visually.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The class structure of bringing in written pieces and casting classmates to read them aloud was very helpful, as well as entertaining. In the dramatic writing format, there is nothing like hearing a piece read aloud to help make decisions and elicit feedback. Both giving feedback on others' work as well as getting feedback on my own writing was incredibly helpful in learning how to successfully write for the stage.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Professor Bell gives amazing feedback. He fosters a learning environment in which everyone feels (or seems to feel) comfortable. I love the workshop style of the class.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Implementing in-class readings of student scripts was both an effective tool for figuring out what did and didn't work in a given script, as well as facilitating a fun and engaging environment for all students. Even when your script wasn't being read, it was exciting to read what other students were working on and fostered a flowing marketplace of creative ideas.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Perhaps more readings and discussions of what makes professional plays work and how to incorporate these writing strategies into our work. I know this is hard to balance while prioritizing student work, but if there was a 300-level version of the class that was able to delve deeper into technique, that is certainly something I'd love to take. As an introductory class for all ability levels, however, I don't see this as a shortcoming. More so a humble request for more course offerings for students to explore these concepts on a deeper level.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The writing assignments and the reading out-loud of the student's work made it so stimulating!

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
